articles.author: Samuel Edyme
articles.description:
As the crypto world anticipates the US Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC)’s decision on spot Ethereum ETFs, Samson Mow, CEO of Bitcoin adoption firm Jan3, has voiced skepticism about the potential of Ethereum-based ETFs compared to Bitcoin.
 
He argues that the imminent approval of these funds is not necessarily a bullish signal for Ethereum, predicting that they will “massively underperform” compared to Bitcoin ETFs.
 
 
Mow’s Call: Why Ethereum Holders Shoud Probably Cash Out Now
 
Diving deeper into the Bitcoin advocate remarks, Mow suggests that this period may be the last opportunity for Ethereum holders to sell their holdings at a favorable price relative to Bitcoin.
 
He points to the lack of staking rewards and the lower demand for Ethereum in various markets as reasons for h…
articles.title: Expert Warns: Sell Your Ethereum (ETH) Now Before It’s Too Late – Here’s Why

PrimeXBT, a leading name in the Cryptocurrency trading industry, unveiled a comprehensive overhaul of its brand, website, and platform. This update reflects the broker’s mission to “democratise the financial markets” and “make an all-in-one platform available to all”, regardless of experience level.
 
Since its inception in 2018, PrimeXBT has served over a million traders across more than 150 countries. It has established itself as a formidable entity in the online trading space. Their all-in-one platform allows clients to trade Crypto Futures and CFDs on various asset classes.
 
Enhanced trading features and increased accessibility
 
PrimeXBT has introduced significant upgrades to its trading suite, directly influenced by client feedback, as revealed in the brand’s “We listen” campaign. T…

articles.author: Christian Encila
articles.description:
The Ethereum (ETH) community is in a tizzy after two prominent researchers from the Ethereum Foundation, Justin Drake and Dankrad Feist, disclosed their involvement with EigenLayer. This restaking protocol has emerged as a potential game-changer in the Ethereum ecosystem, but the researchers’ lucrative advisory roles have ignited concerns about conflicts of interest.
 
 
Transparency Or Self-Serving? The Disclosure Debate
 
The drama unfolded on a social media platform formerly known as Twitter (X). Drake, on May 18th, announced his advisory position at EigenLayer, emphasizing transparency and the importance of the community being informed.
 
 
I recently became an advisor to the EigenFoundation. I feel the community deserves transparency so here is an extended disclosure :)
 
1) The advis…
articles.title: Can Ethereum Trust Its Own? Researchers’ Side Deals Raise Transparency Concerns

articles.author: Kevin Helms
articles.description: Five U.S. representatives have called on the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) and Chair Gary Gensler to ensure a uniform and fair treatment in their review of upcoming ethereum exchange-traded funds (ETFs), similar to their method used for approving spot bitcoin ETFs. SEC Urged to Maintain Consistency Between Ethereum and Bitcoin ETFs Five U.S. […]
articles.title: US Lawmakers Pressure SEC to Apply Same Principles for Ethereum as Bitcoin ETFs

articles.author: Jeff  Wilser
articles.description: A year ago, “Crypto+AI” sounded like a game of “VC mad libs.” Now, as real-world applications begin to emerge, the idea makes much more sense. Jeff Wilser, who is hosting the AI Summit at Consensus 2024, offers a preview of the programming and reviews the decentralized AI state-of-play.
articles.title: Why Decentralized AI Is Gaining Steam

articles.author: Rebecca Rettig
articles.description: Here are some ways users and developers, the lifeblood of crypto, can help move better legislation through Congress, writes Rebecca Rettig, Chief Legal & Policy Officer at Polygon Labs.
articles.title: Grassroots Policy Advocates Are Key to Seeding Crypto Innovation

articles.author: Mason Marcobello
articles.description: The rise of Farcaster and portable “social graphs” will change the relationship between brand marketers and end-users, says the founder of JUMP, a network for Web3 branding executives.
articles.title: Jeff Kauffman: Decentralized Social Will Revolutionize Marketing

articles.author: Jamie Redman
articles.description: Bitcoin’s mining difficulty increased by 1.48% at block height 844,704, reaching 84.38 trillion. This adjustment aligns with Bitcoin’s overall hashrate exceeding the 600 exahash per second (EH/s) mark. Bitcoin Network Difficulty Increases by 1.48% On May 23, 2024, at block 844,704, the difficulty adjusted from 83.14 trillion to 84.38 trillion. This rise follows a 5.62% […]
articles.title: Bitcoin Difficulty Rises 1.48% Reaching 84.38 Trillion at Block 844,704

articles.author: Jeff  Wilser
articles.description: AI is taking over our lives but exactly what goes on inside AI systems is unclear. Two researchers from EQTY Lab shine a light on how to make these mechanics more visible.
articles.title: Demystifying AI’s Black Box: Ariana Spring and Andrew Stanco on How Blockchain Tech Can Shine a Light on Hidden Inputs

articles.author: Scott Matherson
articles.description:
Crypto analyst James Check (also known as Checkmatey) has predicted that Bitcoin could still make further moves to the upside. However, he warned about an “escape velocity” that could send the flagship crypto’s price spiraling down. 
 
What The Escape Velocity Means And How It Affects Bitcoin
 
Simply put, escape velocity is the minimum speed at which a person or object needs to escape the Earth’s gravitational pull (i.e., the force that brings one back down to Earth). Crypto analyst James Check referred to this term while noting that it is likely that Bitcoin hasn’t reached the point of “euphoric escape velocity yet.”
 
 
This suggests that the crypto token has yet to reach a point where it can be said that its price is unlikely to drop beyond a critical support level like $70,000. The an…
articles.title: Crypto Analyst Says Bitcoin Rally Is Far From Over As It’s Yet To Reach Escape Velocity- What This Means
